org.jetel.util.stream

Class StreamUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.util.stream.StreamUtils

  • public class StreamUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple routines for streams manipulating.

        closeStream - should be the given stream closed on exit?

        string representation of given input stream

        out -
        sourceSize - the size of the source or 0 when unknown

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.InputStream src,
        java.io.OutputStream dst,
        boolean closeSrc,
        boolean closeDst)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Read all available bytes from one stream and copy them to the other stream or to nothing. Stream may be automatic closed if specified.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        out - target stream, may be null
        closeSrc - if true, close input stream finally
        closeDst - if true, close output stream finally
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readBlocking

        public static int readBlocking(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel channel,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to read as much as possible bytes to the given buffer from the given channel. It is somehow blocking operation, even incoming data are not ready in channel, operation tries to populate complete remaining bytes in buffer. Only end of stream can cause the buffer is not completely populated.
        Parameters:
        channel - source channel
        buffer - populated byte buffer
        Returns:
        number of read bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readBlocking

        public static int readBlocking(java.io.InputStream stream,
               byte[] buffer,
               int offset,
               int length)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to read length bytes to the given buffer from the given stream. It is somehow blocking operation, even incoming data are not ready in channel, operation tries to populate complete remaining bytes in buffer. Only end of stream can cause the buffer is not completely populated.

        Returns 0 when requesting 0 bytes from a stream that has reached EOF, which differs from readBlocking(ReadableByteChannel, ByteBuffer).

        Parameters:
        stream - source InputStream
        buffer - populated byte buffer
        offset - starting position in the buffer
        length - number of requested bytes
        Returns:
        number of read bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readBlocking

        public static int readBlocking(java.io.InputStream stream,
               byte[] buffer)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to read buffer.length bytes to the given buffer from the given stream, starting at offset 0. It is somehow blocking operation, even incoming data are not ready in channel, operation tries to populate complete remaining bytes in buffer. Only end of stream can cause the buffer is not completely populated.

        Returns 0 when requesting 0 bytes from a stream that has reached EOF, which differs from readBlocking(ReadableByteChannel, ByteBuffer).

        Parameters:
        stream - source InputStream
        buffer - populated byte buffer
        Returns:
        number of read bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
